nodes.bodyText:
why would you not use Logger defined 
  
    
      geode/geode-core/src/main/java/org/apache/geode/cache/query/internal/DefaultQuery.java
    
    
         Line 69
      in
      d8fc2e1
    
    
    
    

        
          
           private static final Logger logger = LogService.getLogger();

I was using the same pattern found elsewhere in the class (specifically in the two endTrace() methods) for consistency. The defined logger appears to not be used at all in the class as things stand, but if it's better to do so, I can replace all calls to this.cache.getLogger() in the class with logger.

Interesting pattern indeed. Wonder why the Cache would be exposing it's logger like that.
If you want, you could always set the logger in the constructor.
Wonder if there is a real reason why the cache is exposing it's logger this way.
But thank you for amending.
